oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An expedient osmium(VI)/K3Fe(CN)(6)-mediated selective oxidation of benzylic, allylic and propargylic alcohols
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
BETHI, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: SOLVENT-FREE CONDITIONS
PALLADIUM-CATALYZED OXIDATION
MANGANESE-DIOXIDE OXIDATION
AQUEOUS HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE
SCHIFF-BASE COMPLEX
AEROBIC OXIDATION
SECONDARY ALCOHOLS
MOLECULAR-OXYGEN
CARBONYL-COMPOUNDS
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A chemoselective osmium(VI) catalyzed oxidation of benzylic, allylic and propargylic alcohols using K3Fe(CN)(6) as a secondary oxidant is described. This protocol is operationally simple and exhibits excellent chemoselectivity favouring the oxidation of benzylic alcohols over the aliphatic alcohols. A larger scale reaction was also found to be compatible.
